content.question: Which of the following British actions is most consistent with Salisbury's stated position regarding the Chinese Empire?

choices.label: The sending of an expeditionary force to fight the Boxer Rebellion, which sought to end foreign influence in China
The sale of British weapons and weapon designs to Japan
The expansion of the territory of Hong Kong through a treaty with the Chinese imperial government
British missionariesâ€™ condemnation of the production and use of opium in China

content.answer: The sending of an expeditionary force to fight the Boxer Rebellion, which sought to end foreign influence in China

topic.text: 7.9: Causation in 19th-Century Perspectives and Political Developments

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain a historical concept, development, or process.
